mods.note: This piece of sheet music is included in a bound volume once owed by Miss Nora Gardner, a Tennessee resident. This particular composition has an inscription on the front cover in pencil that reads "Nora Gardner Columbia Tenn Jan 30th 1863." The song is a Scotch ballad sung by Jenny Lind that tells of the courtship of a Scottish lass by her "Bonny Jocky" and the fact that she would not give in to his affection unless he married her.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.
